meta.data_completeness_note: Test run — many pricing fields unverified. Several school websites blocked automated fetch.

competitors.name: International House Tbilisi
competitors.price_range_local: 475 GEL / 5-week intensive; regular term pricing behind contact form
competitors.notes: Largest English school in Georgia. First IHWO affiliate in former Soviet Union (1989). Only authorised Cambridge Assessment centre in Georgia. The market leader — appears in every search and directory. Published 2025-2026 academic calendar.

competitors.name: British Council Georgia
competitors.notes: Official IELTS test administrator in Georgia. Teaching center operational since 2012. Offers both in-person and online (EnglishScore Tutors). UK Government-funded English Clubs in Georgia. Premium brand with institutional credibility.

competitors.name: American Language Center (ALC) Tbilisi
competitors.notes: Partnership with American Councils Tbilisi. Native-speaker teachers. Strong test-prep focus (TOEFL, SAT, GRE). Located at Chavchavadze Ave. Appeals to university-bound students and professionals.

competitors.name: EMCAN English Training Center
competitors.price_range_local: 320 GEL / 6-week course (max 5 students); 50 GEL discount for one-time payment
competitors.notes: Widest test prep range in the market (IELTS, TOEFL, FCE, CAE, PTE, OET, GRE, GMAT, SAT). Small class sizes (max 5). Also serves Azerbaijan, Uzbekistan, Armenia via online. Located near Liberty Square/Rustaveli. Competitive pricing — most affordable verified provider.

competitors.name: Goga Askurava Language Centre

google_rating.note: Listed on Google Maps with 5-star rating; review count not captured

competitors.notes: Located on Chavchavadze Avenue (prime area). Uses simultaneous translation method — claims 3-4x faster vocabulary retention. Strong Google Maps rating. No website found — may rely on word of mouth and Google Maps listing.

competitors.name: SpeakUp Language Center
competitors.price_range_local: 40 GEL trial lesson (credited to tuition if enrolled)
competitors.notes: Branding emphasizes spoken/conversational skills. Offers both online and offline. Trial lesson model is a good acquisition funnel. Also teaches Georgian to foreigners — captures expat market.

competitors.name: The Language Laboratory
competitors.notes: Multi-language school (up to 10 languages). Claims certified teachers with many years of experience. Limited online footprint — single source only.

competitors.name: Lingua House Language Center
competitors.notes: Located at 25 Abashidze St. Appears to serve high-profile clients (MPs, doctors, lawyers). Source is an older Google Groups post — may need recency verification. Staff includes a USA Fulbright Scholar.

competitors.name: Languages & Tourism Centre Georgia (GLT)
competitors.notes: Operating since 2010. Positions as #1 private school for teaching Georgian to foreigners. International student base. Also offers cultural experiences (cooking class). Tourist/expat focus may mean English courses are secondary.

competitors.name: Preply Tutors (Tbilisi-based)
certifications: Varies by tutor — some CELTA/TEFL, many uncertified
competitors.notes: Not a school but a significant market force. Aggregates freelance tutors. Wide price range. No quality floor — buyer must vet. Represents the informal/gig economy segment of the market.

competitors.name: Apprentus Tutors (Tbilisi-based)
competitors.notes: Another tutor marketplace serving Tbilisi. Less prominent than Preply locally. Offers home tuition and online options.

landscape.maturity_justification: 11 identifiable providers with clear tier separation. Three major international brands present (IH, British Council, American Councils). Most established schools have professional websites. However, several mid-tier providers lack websites or have minimal online presence. Pricing data is inconsistent — some publish fees, others require direct contact. The market shows signs of professionalizing but hasn't reached full maturity.
market_gaps: No provider found specializing exclusively in industry-specific English (medical, legal, tech)
Limited verified evening/weekend scheduling — most schools don't publish schedules publicly
No subscription or unlimited-access pricing model observed
No prominent online-only local school — online segment is dominated by global platforms (Preply, Apprentus)
Corporate/B2B English training appears underserved — only British Council and EMCAN mention it explicitly

dominant_players.name: International House Tbilisi
dominant_players.why: Longest operating (since 1989), largest school, only Cambridge Authorised Centre, CELTA/DELTA provider, appears in every search result and directory

dominant_players.name: British Council Georgia
dominant_players.why: Strongest institutional brand, official IELTS test centre, UK Government backing, both online and in-person, free community English Clubs

price_bands.mid_range_usd: 15-25/hour (local schools, group rates implied from course fees)
price_bands.premium_range_usd: 25-45/hour (estimated for IH, British Council, ALC individual lessons)
price_bands.note: Most schools price by course/term, not hourly. Per-hour rates are derived estimates. Budget segment is dominated by freelance tutors on platforms.

regulatory.business_license: Education license from Ministry of Education required for accredited programs. Private language tutoring appears largely unregulated.
regulatory.teacher_qualifications: No mandated qualifications identified for private English instruction. International certifications (CELTA, DELTA, TEFL) used as market differentiators, not legal requirements.
regulatory.accreditation: Voluntary. National Center for Educational Quality Enhancement handles accreditation. IH Tbilisi is the only Cambridge-authorized centre.
regulatory.foreign_ownership: No restrictions identified. Foreign entities can register LLCs in Georgia. Georgia ranks high on ease of doing business indices.
regulatory.tax_treatment: Education services may be VAT-exempt — needs verification from Georgian tax code.
regulatory.language_of_instruction: No restrictions identified for private language institutions.
regulatory.note: Regulatory data is inferred from general Georgia business environment knowledge. No primary regulatory sources were accessed in this test run. Full run should check Ministry of Education website and Georgian legal databases.

searches_performed.query: IELTS TOEFL preparation center Tbilisi Georgia
British Council Georgia Tbilisi English courses programs
Tbilisi English courses price per hour GEL adult 2025
language center Tbilisi site:facebook.com OR site:google.com
Tbilisi English school ELC GLT Lingua SpeakUp
IH Tbilisi fees GEL 2025 general English adult course price
Georgetown English Plus Educate Georgia GLT English courses
smapse Tbilisi English language schools top 7 list price

dead_ends: Most school websites returned 403 on automated fetch — pricing details could not be scraped
smapse.com lists only 1 English language school in Tbilisi (IH) — not useful as a directory
Georgian-language searches were not executed in this test run — would require native script queries
Facebook/Instagram/Telegram searches were not executed — would need platform-specific tools
MyCity.ge, SS.ge directories were not searchable via web search
follow_up_needed: Manual visit to IH Tbilisi /fees/ page to capture full term pricing
Manual visit to British Council Georgia for course fees
Georgian-language Google searches for schools not visible in English/Russian results
Facebook group search: 'English courses Tbilisi' and Georgian equivalent
Google Maps search to capture ratings, review counts, and discover unlisted schools
Verify whether Lingua House is still operating (source was an older post)
Check if there are Batumi/Kutaisi branches of any Tbilisi providers
